page.title: 11VILLAGE HALLS.
page.content: {Doulting and Cranmore}each have a village hall where villagers can hold functions such as{dances, badminton, {wedding receptions, Harvest Suppers and{meetings.}The hall at Doulting is new because it is the new school hall. The school uses it during lesson times and after school the village use it. The village finished an extension in 1985 which has a bar, coat rails and a carpet in. The people can also use the school kitchen where our school dinners are cooked. At Cranmore their hall is older and smaller. It has got a wooden floor and a partition which divides the room into two. At Doulting the committee have built a large car park which can be used for{tennis}and a school play-ground. At Cranmore there are some prints by the{artist and{painter David Shepherd}and signed by him.
